commands.name: az ml model archive
examples: az ml model archive --name my-model --resource-group my-resource-group --workspace-name my-workspace
az ml model archive --name my-model --version 1 --resource-group my-resource-group --workspace-name my-workspace

commands.name: az ml model create
examples: az ml model create --file model.yml --resource-group my-resource-group --workspace-name my-workspace
az ml model create --name my-model --version 1 --path ./my-model --resource-group my-resource-group --workspace-name my-workspace
az ml model create --name my-model --version 1 --path runs:/c42d2507-4953-4a7c-a4c1-2b5bfe0ac64e/model/ --type mlflow_model --resource-group my-resource-group --workspace-name my-workspace

az ml model create --name my-model --version 1 --path azureml://jobs/c42d2507-4953-4a7c-a4c1-2b5bfe0ac64e/outputs/artifacts/paths/model/ --resource-group my-resource-group --workspace-name my-workspace
az ml model create --name my-model --version 1 --path azureml://datastores/myblobstore/paths/models/cifar10/cifar.pt --resource-group my-resource-group --workspace-name my-workspace

commands.name: az ml model download
examples: az ml model download --name my-model --version 1 --resource-group my-resource-group --workspace-name my-workspace
az ml model download --name my-model --version 1  --download-path local_path --resource-group my-resource-group --workspace-name my-workspace

commands.name: az ml model list
commands.summary: List models in a workspace/registry. If you are using a registry, replace `--workspace-name my-workspace` with the `--registry-name <registry-name>` option.
examples: az ml model list --resource-group my-resource-group --workspace-name my-workspace
az ml model list --name my-model --resource-group my-resource-group --workspace-name my-workspace
az ml model list --query "[].{Name:name}"  --output table --resource-group my-resource-group --workspace-name my-workspace

commands.name: az ml model package
commands.summary: Package a model into an environment.
examples: az ml model package --name my-model --version my-version --resource-group my-resource-group --workspace-name my-workspace --file my-package.yml

commands.name: az ml model restore
examples: az ml model restore --name my-model --resource-group my-resource-group --workspace-name my-workspace
az ml model restore --name my-model --version 1 --resource-group my-resource-group --workspace-name my-workspace

commands.name: az ml model share
commands.summary: Share a specific model from workspace to registry.
examples: az ml model share --name my-model --version my-version --resource-group my-resource-group --workspace-name my-workspace --share-with-name new-name-in-registry --share-with-version new-version-in-registry --registry-name my-registry

commands.name: az ml model show
commands.summary: Show details for a model in a workspace/registry. If you are using a registry, replace `--workspace-name my-workspace` with the `--registry-name <registry-name>` option.
examples: az ml model show --name my-model --version 1 --resource-group my-resource-group --workspace-name my-workspace

commands.name: az ml model update
commands.summary: Update a model in a workspace/registry.
examples: az ml model update --name my-model --version 1 --set flavors.python_function.python_version=3.8 --resource-group my-resource-group --workspace-name my-workspace
